items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Fast till Pradosh Kaal; offer water, bilva leaves, and prayers to Lord Shiva in the evening.
items.significance: Dedicated to Lord Shiva; observed for peace, prosperity, and removal of obstacles.

items.name: Pausha Purnima
items.procedure: Take a holy bath, perform daan (charity), and recite Vishnu/Shiva stotras.
items.significance: Full Moon of Pausha month; holy baths, charity, and spiritual purification.

items.name: Shakambhari Purnima
items.procedure: Worship Goddess Shakambhari with flowers, fruits, and sattvik offerings; read Devi Mahatmya if possible.
items.significance: Worship of Goddess Shakambhari, the nourisher of life and vegetation.

items.name: Sankashti Chaturthi (Sakat Chauth)
items.procedure: Observe a fast till moonrise; offer modak/durva to Lord Ganesha and do aarti after moon दर्शन.
items.significance: Fast for Lord Ganesha to overcome obstacles, fear, and difficulties.

items.name: Shattila Ekadashi
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; use sesame (til) in charity/food; chant Vishnu sahasranama.
items.significance: Ekadashi of Magha month; sesame offerings cleanse past karmas and sins.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva puja in Pradosh Kaal with bilva, dhoop, deep; recite Pradosh Vrat katha.
items.significance: Shiva worship during evening twilight for peace and prosperity.

items.name: Masik Shivaratri
items.procedure: Fast (optional); perform Shiva abhishekam (milk/water) and chant 'Om Namah Shivaya'.
items.significance: Monthly Shivaratri; devotion to Lord Shiva for inner transformation.

items.name: Makar Sankranti
items.procedure: Offer prayers to Surya Dev; donate til-gud, blankets; take holy bath; kite flying in many regions.
items.significance: Sun’s transition into Capricorn (Makara); marks spiritual awakening and auspicious beginnings.

items.name: Uttarayan Parva
items.procedure: Surya worship, charity, and sattvik food; considered auspicious for spiritual practices.
items.significance: Start of the Sun’s northward journey; considered highly auspicious for spiritual growth.

items.name: Mauni Amavasya / Magha Amavasya
items.procedure: Observe silence (maun), holy bath, pitru tarpan, and charity; avoid tamasic food.
items.significance: Silent austerity, ancestor rituals, and purification through fasting and holy baths.

items.name: Magha Gupta Navratri – Day 1
items.procedure: Begin Devi sadhana; kalash sthapana (if followed), mantra japa, and sattvik diet.
items.significance: Secret Navratri dedicated to Tantric and Shakti sadhana.

items.name: Gupta Navratri – Day 2
items.procedure: Continue Devi worship with japa, dhyana, and light fasting as per tradition.
items.significance: Worship of hidden forms of Maa Durga for inner power.

items.name: Gupta Navratri – Day 3
items.procedure: Devotional practices like Durga Saptashati path or mantra sadhana.
items.significance: Devotional practices for spiritual discipline and protection.

items.name: Gupta Navratri – Day 4
items.procedure: Offer flowers, deep, and naivedya to Devi; maintain purity and restraint.
items.significance: Sadhana for strength, focus, and divine grace.

items.name: Vasant Panchami
items.procedure: Saraswati puja; wear yellow; begin learning/music/arts; offer books and instruments for blessings.
items.significance: Worship of Goddess Saraswati; learning, arts, and wisdom begin.

items.name: Gupta Navratri – Day 6
items.procedure: Mantra sadhana and spiritual discipline; keep sattvik diet and simple routine.
items.significance: Spiritual purification and mantra sadhana.

items.name: Ratha Saptami
items.procedure: Surya arghya in the morning; recite Aditya Hridayam; take bath and do charity.
items.significance: Celebration of Surya Dev’s chariot; health, vitality, and life energy.

items.name: Bhishma Ashtami
items.procedure: Offer water and sesame; remembrance of Bhishma; charity for ancestors.
items.significance: Honors Bhishma Pitamaha; prayers for liberation and ancestral peace.

items.name: Gupta Navratri – Day 9
items.procedure: Final day puja; kanya pujan (if followed); conclude with Devi aarti and prayers.
items.significance: Completion of Navratri; attainment of hidden spiritual knowledge.

items.name: Jaya Ekadashi
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja; chant 'Om Namo Narayanaya' and read Ekadashi katha.
items.significance: Vishnu worship; destroys fear, grants success and liberation.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva puja in Pradosh Kaal; offer bilva leaves and perform aarti.
items.significance: Shiva worship for fulfillment of desires and mental peace.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Pradosh Kaal Shiva puja with bilva leaves, deep, and mantra chanting.
items.significance: Worship of Lord Shiva during evening twilight to remove obstacles and gain spiritual strength.

items.name: Magha Purnima
items.procedure: Holy bath, charity, and devotion; perform Satyanarayan puja if followed.
items.significance: Full moon of Magha month; sacred baths, charity, and devotion bring spiritual merit.

items.name: Sankashti Chaturthi
items.procedure: Fast till moonrise; Ganesha puja and aarti after moon दर्शन.
items.significance: Fasting for Lord Ganesha to overcome problems, fears, and delays in life.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship with abhishekam and Pradosh katha.
items.significance: Dedicated to Shiva for peace, prosperity, and forgiveness of sins.

items.name: Masik Shivaratri
items.procedure: Shiva abhishekam, japa, and night prayer (as per ability).
items.significance: Monthly observance honoring Lord Shiva for inner purification and spiritual progress.

items.name: Kalashtami
items.procedure: Worship Bhairava; light diya, offer flowers, and chant Bhairava mantras.
items.significance: Worship of Lord Bhairava for protection from negativity and fear.

items.name: Vijaya Ekadashi
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja and katha; charity next morning.
items.significance: Vishnu worship; observing this Ekadashi brings victory, success, and removal of past karmas.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Pradosh Kaal Shiva puja; chant 'Om Namah Shivaya'.
items.significance: Shiva worship to remove health, financial, and emotional difficulties.

items.name: Maha Shivaratri
items.procedure: Day fast; night vigil; 4 prahar Shiva abhishekam (as per tradition).
items.significance: Grand night of Lord Shiva; fasting and night vigil lead to spiritual awakening and liberation.

items.name: Amavasya (Phalguna Amavasya)
items.procedure: Pitru tarpan, charity, and simple sattvik food; prayers for ancestors.
items.significance: New moon day for ancestor rituals, fasting, charity, and spiritual cleansing.

items.name: Phulera Dooj
items.procedure: Radha-Krishna worship; light celebration with flowers; auspicious for functions in many regions.
items.significance: Auspicious day dedicated to Radha–Krishna; considered free from doshas for marriages and celebrations.

items.name: Chandra Darshan
items.procedure: Offer arghya to Moon; pray for peace of mind and prosperity.
items.significance: First sighting of the Moon; worship for mental peace and prosperity.

items.name: Vinayaka Chaturthi
items.procedure: Ganesha puja; offer modak and durva; start new work with blessings.
items.significance: Ganesha worship for wisdom, success, and removal of new obstacles.

items.name: Skanda Shashti
items.procedure: Murugan/Kartikeya worship; recite Skanda shashti katha; simple fasting (optional).
items.significance: Dedicated to Lord Murugan (Kartikeya); victory over evil and inner strength.

items.name: Ratha Saptami (South Indian observance)
items.procedure: Surya worship and arghya; Aditya Hridayam; charity for health and longevity.
items.significance: Sun worship for health, energy, and longevity (observed in some regions this month).

items.name: Bhanu Saptami
items.procedure: Surya puja; offer water (arghya) in the morning; charity for health and vitality.
items.significance: Special Saptami dedicated to Surya Dev for health and vitality.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship in Pradosh Kaal; light diya and do aarti.
items.significance: Evening Shiva worship for peace, prosperity, and divine blessings.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Pradosh Kaal Shiva puja with bilva leaves and abhishekam.
items.significance: Dedicated to Lord Shiva; observed to remove sins, obstacles, and bring peace.

items.name: Magha Purnima (some regions)
items.procedure: Holy bath, charity, and puja as per local tradition.
items.significance: Full moon worship with charity and sacred baths for spiritual merit.

items.name: Sankashti Chaturthi
items.procedure: Fast till moonrise; Ganesha puja and aarti after moon दर्शन.
items.significance: Fast for Lord Ganesha to overcome challenges and gain wisdom.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship and mantra chanting.
items.significance: Shiva worship for mental clarity, prosperity, and well-being.

items.name: Masik Shivaratri
items.procedure: Shiva abhishekam and night prayers (as per ability).
items.significance: Monthly Shivaratri; devotion to Shiva for inner transformation.

items.name: Kalashtami
items.procedure: Bhairava worship; light diya and chant Bhairava mantras.
items.significance: Worship of Lord Bhairava for protection from negativity and fear.

items.name: Amalaki Ekadashi
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja and Amla tree worship (if available).
items.significance: Dedicated to Lord Vishnu and the sacred Amla tree; health, longevity, and purification.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Pradosh Kaal Shiva puja; offer bilva leaves and do aarti.
items.significance: Evening Shiva worship to overcome difficulties and gain blessings.

items.name: Holi (Phalguna Purnima)
items.procedure: Celebrate with colors; meet family and friends; share sweets; maintain kindness and harmony.
items.significance: Celebration of victory of good over evil; renewal of joy and togetherness.

items.name: Chaitra Krishna Pratipada
items.procedure: Simple prayers; start disciplined spiritual routine; avoid excess.
items.significance: Beginning of the waning lunar phase; reflection and spiritual discipline.

items.name: Amavasya (Phalguna Amavasya)
items.procedure: Pitru tarpan, charity, and sattvik food; prayers for ancestors.
items.significance: New moon rituals for ancestors, charity, and spiritual cleansing.

items.name: Chaitra Navratri – Day 1
items.procedure: Kalash sthapana (if followed), Devi puja, mantra japa, sattvik diet.
items.significance: Beginning of Navratri; worship of Maa Durga for strength and purity.

items.name: Chaitra Navratri – Day 2
items.procedure: Continue Devi worship and fasting as per tradition.
items.significance: Devotion to the second form of Durga for balance and courage.

items.name: Chaitra Navratri – Day 3
items.procedure: Puja, japa, and charity; maintain purity and discipline.
items.significance: Worship for mental clarity, devotion, and inner strength.

items.name: Chaitra Navratri – Day 4
items.procedure: Devi puja and readings; focus on stability and restraint.
items.significance: Observed for stability, wisdom, and spiritual growth.

items.name: Chaitra Navratri – Day 5
items.procedure: Continue Devi worship; offer fruits/naivedya; chant Durga mantras.
items.significance: Sadhana for discipline, patience, and divine grace.

items.name: Chaitra Navratri – Day 6
items.procedure: Puja and japa; seek courage and fearlessness in sadhana.
items.significance: Worship for courage, focus, and removal of fear.

items.name: Chaitra Navratri – Day 7
items.procedure: Devi worship (Kalratri form in many traditions); maintain sattvik discipline.
items.significance: Devotion to Maa Kalratri for protection and strength.

items.name: Chaitra Navratri – Day 8 (Ashtami)
items.procedure: Ashtami puja; kanya pujan (if followed); charity and prayers.
items.significance: Worship of Maa Mahagauri; purity, peace, and blessings.

items.name: Chaitra Navratri – Day 9 (Navami)
items.procedure: Navami puja; conclude Navratri with aarti and devotion.
items.significance: Completion of Navratri; attainment of divine blessings and fulfillment.

items.name: Rama Navami
items.procedure: Read Ramayana, do Rama puja, chant 'Jai Shri Ram', distribute prasad.
items.significance: Birth of Lord Rama; symbolizes dharma, truth, and ideal living.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva puja during Pradosh Kaal; bilva offering and aarti.
items.significance: Shiva worship for harmony, health, and success.

items.name: Papmochani Ekadashi
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja; charity and prayer for forgiveness.
items.significance: Vishnu worship; removes sins and past karmic burdens.

items.name: Chaitra Purnima
items.procedure: Holy bath, charity, and puja; many observe Satyanarayan katha.
items.significance: Full moon of Chaitra month; spiritual upliftment and charity.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Observe vrat till Pradosh Kaal; Shiva puja in evening with bilva leaves, diya, and mantra chanting.
items.significance: Worship of Lord Shiva in the evening to remove obstacles and gain peace and prosperity.

items.name: Chaitra Purnima
items.procedure: Holy bath, daan (charity), and puja; many do Satyanarayan katha as per tradition.
items.significance: Full moon of Chaitra month; charity, devotion, and spiritual upliftment.

items.name: Hanuman Jayanti
items.procedure: Hanuman puja, read Hanuman Chalisa/Sundarkand; offer sindoor, flowers, and prasad.
items.significance: Birth of Lord Hanuman; observed for strength, devotion, courage, and protection.

items.name: Sankashti Chaturthi
items.procedure: Fast till moonrise; Ganesha puja and aarti after moon दर्शन; offer modak/durva.
items.significance: Ganesha fasting to remove problems and bring wisdom and success.

items.name: Masik Shivaratri
items.procedure: Shiva abhishekam (water/milk), japa of 'Om Namah Shivaya', and night prayers (optional).
items.significance: Monthly Shivaratri for inner purification and devotion to Shiva.

items.name: Kalashtami
items.procedure: Worship Bhairava; light diya, offer flowers, and chant Bhairava mantras for protection.
items.significance: Worship of Lord Bhairava for protection from fear and negative forces.

items.name: Kamada Ekadashi
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja, katha, and charity; eat sattvik food next day after parana.
items.significance: Vishnu worship; fulfillment of desires and removal of sins.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva puja in Pradosh Kaal; bilva offering, abhishekam, and aarti.
items.significance: Shiva worship for harmony, health, and mental peace.

items.name: Amavasya (Chaitra Amavasya)
items.procedure: Pitru tarpan, charity, and prayer for ancestors; keep simple sattvik diet.
items.significance: New moon rituals for ancestors, charity, and spiritual cleansing.

items.name: Mesha Sankranti
items.procedure: Surya puja; holy bath; donate seasonal items; begin auspicious routines.
items.significance: Sun’s entry into Aries; marks the solar new year and spiritual renewal.

items.name: Chandra Darshan
items.procedure: Offer arghya to Moon; prayers for calm mind and prosperity.
items.significance: First sighting of the Moon; worship for mental peace and prosperity.

items.name: Vinayaka Chaturthi
items.procedure: Ganesha puja; offer durva and modak; start new work with blessings.
items.significance: Worship of Lord Ganesha for success in new beginnings.

items.name: Skanda Shashti
items.procedure: Murugan/Kartikeya worship; recite Skanda prayers; optional fasting.
items.significance: Dedicated to Lord Murugan/Kartikeya; victory over negativity and inner strength.

items.name: Ramanuja Jayanti
items.procedure: Remember Sri Ramanujacharya; read teachings; do Vishnu puja and charity.
items.significance: Birth of Sri Ramanujacharya; celebrates devotion, equality, and Vishishtadvaita philosophy.

items.name: Varuthini Ekadashi
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja and katha; charity and prayers for protection.
items.significance: Vishnu worship; protection from misfortune and negative karma.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship with bilva leaves; aarti during Pradosh Kaal.
items.significance: Shiva worship for spiritual growth and fulfillment of desires.

items.name: Akshaya Tritiya
items.procedure: Do charity, start new ventures, worship Lakshmi-Narayana; buy gold (optional, regional).
items.significance: Highly auspicious day; any good deed brings lasting (Akshaya) merit and prosperity.

items.name: Parashurama Jayanti
items.procedure: Vishnu/Parashurama puja; read avatar katha; charity and prayers for dharma.
items.significance: Birth of Lord Parashurama, sixth avatar of Vishnu; restoration of dharma.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship in Pradosh Kaal with bilva leaves and mantra chanting.
items.significance: Evening worship of Lord Shiva to remove sins, obstacles, and gain peace.

items.name: Vaishakha Purnima
items.procedure: Holy bath, charity, and puja; prayers for spiritual merit and peace.
items.significance: Sacred full moon; associated with spiritual merit, charity, and devotion.

items.name: Narasimha Jayanti
items.procedure: Narasimha puja; chant Narasimha mantras; read Prahlad katha; offer sattvik naivedya.
items.significance: Birth of Lord Narasimha; protection from evil and fear.

items.name: Sankashti Chaturthi
items.procedure: Fast till moonrise; Ganesha puja and aarti after moon दर्शन.
items.significance: Fast for Lord Ganesha to overcome difficulties and obstacles.

items.name: Masik Shivaratri
items.procedure: Shiva abhishekam and japa; keep sattvik food and calm routine.
items.significance: Monthly Shivaratri for inner purification and devotion to Shiva.

items.name: Kalashtami
items.procedure: Bhairava worship with diya and prayers for protection and courage.
items.significance: Worship of Lord Bhairava for protection from negativity and fear.

items.name: Mohini Ekadashi
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja and katha; charity and prayer for clarity.
items.significance: Dedicated to Lord Vishnu; removes sins, brings peace and spiritual clarity.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship with bilva leaves; aarti in Pradosh Kaal.
items.significance: Shiva worship for harmony, health, and prosperity.

items.name: Amavasya (Vaishakha Amavasya)
items.procedure: Pitru tarpan, charity, and prayers for ancestors; keep sattvik routine.
items.significance: New moon rituals for ancestors, fasting, charity, and cleansing.

items.name: Chandra Darshan
items.procedure: Moon worship; offer arghya; pray for mental peace and prosperity.
items.significance: First sighting of the Moon; worship for mental peace and prosperity.

items.name: Vinayaka Chaturthi
items.procedure: Ganesha puja; offer modak/durva; begin new tasks with blessings.
items.significance: Ganesha worship for success in new beginnings and wisdom.

items.name: Skanda Shashti
items.procedure: Murugan/Kartikeya worship; recite Skanda prayers; optional fasting.
items.significance: Dedicated to Lord Murugan/Kartikeya for victory and inner strength.

items.name: Apara Ekadashi
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja and katha; charity and prayers for merit.
items.significance: Vishnu worship to destroy sins, negative karma, and attain merit.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva puja in Pradosh Kaal; offer bilva leaves and do aarti.
items.significance: Shiva worship for spiritual growth and stability.

items.name: Ganga Saptami
items.procedure: Prayers to Maa Ganga; charity; remembrance of purity and liberation.
items.significance: Celebrates the descent of River Ganga on earth; purity and liberation.

items.name: Bhanu Saptami
items.procedure: Surya puja; arghya in the morning; charity for health and vitality.
items.significance: Special Saptami dedicated to Surya Dev for health and vitality.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship with bilva leaves; chant 'Om Namah Shivaya'.
items.significance: Evening Shiva worship for fulfillment of desires and peace.

items.name: Shani Jayanti
items.procedure: Shani puja; offer sesame oil and black til; donate black items; pray for relief from hardships.
items.significance: Birth of Lord Shani; prayers to reduce Saturn-related hardships and karma.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva puja in Pradosh Kaal; bilva leaves, diya, and mantra chanting.
items.significance: Evening worship of Lord Shiva for peace, prosperity, and removal of obstacles.

items.name: Jyeshtha Purnima
items.procedure: Holy bath, charity, and prayers; observe fasting if followed.
items.significance: Full moon of Jyeshtha month; charity, fasting, and spiritual merit.

items.name: Vat Savitri Vrat
items.procedure: Married women worship banyan tree; pray for husband's long life; listen to Savitri katha.
items.significance: Married women pray for their husband’s long life, inspired by Savitri’s devotion.

items.name: Sankashti Chaturthi
items.procedure: Fast till moonrise; Ganesha puja; offer modak/durva; aarti after moon दर्शन.
items.significance: Fast for Lord Ganesha to remove difficulties and grant wisdom.

items.name: Masik Shivaratri
items.procedure: Shiva abhishekam, japa, and prayers for inner purification.
items.significance: Monthly devotion to Lord Shiva for inner purification.

items.name: Kalashtami
items.procedure: Bhairava worship; diya and mantra chanting for protection.
items.significance: Worship of Lord Bhairava for protection from fear and negative energies.

items.name: Nirjala Ekadashi
items.procedure: Ekadashi fast without water (as per ability); Vishnu puja and charity next day.
items.significance: Most powerful Ekadashi; fasting without water for Vishnu’s blessings and moksha.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship in Pradosh Kaal; abhishekam and aarti.
items.significance: Shiva worship for health, stability, and spiritual growth.

items.name: Amavasya (Jyeshtha Amavasya)
items.procedure: Pitru tarpan, charity, and sattvik prayers for ancestors.
items.significance: Ancestor rituals, fasting, charity, and spiritual cleansing.

items.name: Chandra Darshan
items.procedure: Offer arghya to Moon; pray for peace and prosperity.
items.significance: First sighting of the Moon; prayers for mental peace and prosperity.

items.name: Vinayaka Chaturthi
items.procedure: Ganesha puja; offer modak/durva; seek success and new beginnings.
items.significance: Worship of Lord Ganesha for success and new beginnings.

items.name: Skanda Shashti
items.procedure: Murugan/Kartikeya worship; recite Skanda prayers; optional fasting.
items.significance: Dedicated to Lord Murugan/Kartikeya for victory over negativity.

items.name: Yogini Ekadashi
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja and charity; prayers for purification.
items.significance: Vishnu worship to cleanse sins and attain spiritual purity.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Pradosh Kaal Shiva worship; bilva leaves and aarti.
items.significance: Shiva worship for harmony and fulfillment of desires.

items.name: Gauri Vrat Begins
items.procedure: Young girls observe vrat and pray to Goddess Gauri for virtues and good future.
items.significance: Young girls pray for good character, devotion, and future marital harmony.

items.name: Ashadha Navratri – Day 1 (Gupta Navratri)
items.procedure: Begin Devi sadhana; mantra japa; sattvik diet and discipline.
items.significance: Secret Navratri focused on intense Shakti sadhana and spiritual discipline.

items.name: Gupta Navratri – Day 2
items.procedure: Continue Devi worship and spiritual practices as per tradition.
items.significance: Worship of hidden forms of Maa Durga for inner power.

items.name: Gupta Navratri – Day 3
items.procedure: Mantra sadhana and prayers; maintain purity and restraint.
items.significance: Spiritual purification and mantra sadhana.

items.name: Gupta Navratri – Day 4
items.procedure: Devi puja and japa; seek courage, clarity, and protection.
items.significance: Sadhana for courage, clarity, and divine protection.

items.name: Gupta Navratri – Day 5
items.procedure: Continue Devi worship with discipline and sattvik routine.
items.significance: Worship for discipline and inner balance.

items.name: Gupta Navratri – Day 6
items.procedure: Devi puja and mantra japa; conclude the day with aarti.
items.significance: Continued Shakti worship for spiritual strength and growth.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva puja in Pradosh Kaal; bilva leaves, diya, and aarti.
items.significance: Evening worship of Lord Shiva for peace, prosperity, and removal of obstacles.

items.name: Ashadha Purnima / Guru Purnima
items.procedure: Honor teachers/gurus; perform puja, offer gratitude, and donate as per tradition.
items.significance: Honors Guru; seeking wisdom, guidance, and blessings.

items.name: Sankashti Chaturthi
items.procedure: Fast till moonrise; Ganesha puja and aarti after moon दर्शन.
items.significance: Fast for Lord Ganesha to overcome challenges and delays.

items.name: Masik Shivaratri
items.procedure: Shiva abhishekam and japa; maintain sattvik diet.
items.significance: Monthly devotion to Lord Shiva for inner purification.

items.name: Kalashtami
items.procedure: Bhairava worship; diya, flowers, and mantras for protection.
items.significance: Worship of Lord Bhairava for protection from fear and negativity.

items.name: Deva Shayani Ekadashi (Ashadhi Ekadashi)
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja; begin Chaturmas discipline (as per tradition).
items.significance: Vishnu enters cosmic sleep; beginning of Chaturmas, period of restraint and devotion.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship; abhishekam and aarti in Pradosh Kaal.
items.significance: Shiva worship for harmony and spiritual strength.

items.name: Amavasya (Ashadha Amavasya)
items.procedure: Pitru tarpan, charity, and prayers for ancestors; keep sattvik routine.
items.significance: Ancestor rituals, fasting, and spiritual cleansing.

items.name: Chandra Darshan
items.procedure: Offer arghya to Moon; pray for mental peace and prosperity.
items.significance: First Moon sighting; prayers for mental peace and prosperity.

items.name: Vinayaka Chaturthi
items.procedure: Ganesha puja; offer durva and modak; seek success in new beginnings.
items.significance: Worship of Lord Ganesha for success in new beginnings.

items.name: Skanda Shashti
items.procedure: Murugan/Kartikeya worship; recite Skanda prayers; optional fasting.
items.significance: Dedicated to Lord Murugan/Kartikeya for victory over negativity.

items.name: Gauri Vrat Ends
items.procedure: Conclude vrat with Gauri puja and prayers; donate as per tradition.
items.significance: Completion of girls’ fasting for good character and marital harmony.

items.name: Kamika Ekadashi
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja and katha; charity for spiritual merit.
items.significance: Vishnu worship to remove sins and grant spiritual merit.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship in Pradosh Kaal; aarti and prayers.
items.significance: Shiva worship for health, peace, and prosperity.

items.name: Nag Panchami
items.procedure: Worship Nag devtas; offer दूध/flowers; pray for protection and harmony.
items.significance: Worship of Serpent deities for protection, fertility, and removal of doshas.

items.name: Shitala Saptami
items.procedure: Worship Goddess Shitala; offer cool/sattvik food; pray for health.
items.significance: Worship of Goddess Shitala for protection from diseases and health issues.

items.name: Masik Durgashtami
items.procedure: Durga puja; recite Devi stotras; light diya and offer flowers.
items.significance: Worship of Maa Durga for strength and protection.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva puja; bilva leaves and aarti during Pradosh Kaal.
items.significance: Evening Shiva worship for fulfillment of desires and spiritual stability.

items.name: Shravana Purnima
items.procedure: Holy bath, vows (vrat) and charity; puja as per local tradition.
items.significance: Full moon of Shravana month; associated with devotion and sacred vows.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Pradosh Kaal Shiva worship; bilva leaves, diya, and aarti.
items.significance: Evening worship of Lord Shiva for peace, prosperity, and removal of obstacles.

items.name: Shravana Purnima
items.procedure: Holy bath, charity, and vows; puja as per tradition.
items.significance: Full moon of Shravana month; sacred vows, charity, and devotion are observed.

items.name: Raksha Bandhan
items.procedure: Sisters tie rakhi; brothers give gifts; prayers for protection and well-being.
items.significance: Celebration of the bond between siblings; prayers for protection and well-being.

items.name: Sankashti Chaturthi
items.procedure: Fast till moonrise; Ganesha puja and aarti after moon दर्शन.
items.significance: Fast for Lord Ganesha to remove difficulties and obstacles.

items.name: Gayatri Jayanti
items.procedure: Gayatri mantra japa; havan (optional); prayers for wisdom and purity.
items.significance: Birth of Goddess Gayatri; worship for wisdom, purity, and spiritual enlightenment.

items.name: Masik Shivaratri
items.procedure: Shiva abhishekam and japa; night prayers as per ability.
items.significance: Monthly Shivaratri observed for devotion and inner purification.

items.name: Kalashtami
items.procedure: Bhairava worship; diya and mantra chanting for protection.
items.significance: Worship of Lord Bhairava for protection from fear and negativity.

items.name: Shravana Putrada Ekadashi
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja; prayers for family well-being and progeny (as per belief).
items.significance: Ekadashi for progeny, family well-being, and Vishnu’s blessings.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship; bilva leaves and aarti in Pradosh Kaal.
items.significance: Shiva worship for harmony and spiritual strength.

items.name: Amavasya (Shravana Amavasya)
items.procedure: Pitru tarpan, charity, and prayers; maintain sattvik routine.
items.significance: Ancestor rituals, fasting, and spiritual cleansing.

items.name: Chandra Darshan
items.procedure: Offer arghya to Moon; pray for peace and prosperity.
items.significance: First sighting of the Moon; prayers for mental peace and prosperity.

items.name: Vinayaka Chaturthi
items.procedure: Ganesha puja; modak/durva offering; seek auspicious beginnings.
items.significance: Worship of Lord Ganesha for success and auspicious beginnings.

items.name: Skanda Shashti
items.procedure: Murugan/Kartikeya worship; recite Skanda prayers; optional fasting.
items.significance: Dedicated to Lord Murugan/Kartikeya for courage and victory.

items.name: Aadi Perukku
items.procedure: Offer gratitude to rivers/water; simple puja and community celebrations (regional).
items.significance: Celebration of water’s life-giving force; gratitude to rivers and rain.

items.name: Kajari Teej
items.procedure: Women observe vrat and pray to Shiva-Parvati for marital happiness (regional).
items.significance: Observed by women for marital happiness and family prosperity.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship; bilva leaves and aarti during Pradosh Kaal.
items.significance: Evening Shiva worship for fulfillment of desires and peace.

items.name: Nag Panchami
items.procedure: Worship serpent deities; offer दूध/flowers; pray for protection and harmony.
items.significance: Worship of serpent deities for protection, fertility, and harmony.

items.name: Shravana Shukla Ashtami
items.procedure: Durga worship; recite Devi stotras; light diya for protection.
items.significance: Durga worship for strength and protection.

items.name: Krishna Janmashtami
items.procedure: Fast till midnight; Krishna puja, bhajans, and celebration of जन्मोत्सव.
items.significance: Birth of Lord Krishna; devotion, fasting, and celebration of dharma.

items.name: Dahi Handi
items.procedure: Community celebrations with handi; songs and devotion (regional).
items.significance: Celebration of Krishna’s childhood leelas; joy, unity, and devotion.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship in Pradosh Kaal; abhishekam and aarti.
items.significance: Shiva worship for health, peace, and prosperity.

items.name: Aja Ekadashi
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja and charity; prayers for merit and purification.
items.significance: Vishnu worship; removal of sins and attainment of spiritual merit.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship; bilva leaves and aarti during Pradosh Kaal.
items.significance: Evening worship of Lord Shiva to remove obstacles and gain peace and prosperity.

items.name: Bhadrapada Purnima
items.procedure: Holy bath, charity, and puja; prayers for spiritual merit.
items.significance: Full moon of Bhadrapada month; charity, devotion, and spiritual merit.

items.name: Sankashti Chaturthi
items.procedure: Fast till moonrise; Ganesha puja and aarti after moon दर्शन.
items.significance: Fast for Lord Ganesha to overcome difficulties and delays.

items.name: Masik Shivaratri
items.procedure: Shiva abhishekam and japa; night prayers as per ability.
items.significance: Monthly Shivaratri for inner purification and devotion to Shiva.

items.name: Kalashtami
items.procedure: Bhairava worship; diya and mantra chanting for protection.
items.significance: Worship of Lord Bhairava for protection from fear and negativity.

items.name: Parsva Ekadashi
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja during Chaturmas; charity and prayers for discipline.
items.significance: Vishnu worship during Chaturmas; helps attain spiritual discipline and merit.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship; abhishekam and aarti.
items.significance: Shiva worship for harmony, health, and stability.

items.name: Amavasya (Bhadrapada Amavasya)
items.procedure: Pitru tarpan, charity, and prayers for ancestors; simple sattvik routine.
items.significance: Ancestor rituals, fasting, and spiritual cleansing.

items.name: Chandra Darshan
items.procedure: Offer arghya to Moon; prayers for peace and prosperity.
items.significance: First sighting of the Moon; prayers for mental peace and prosperity.

items.name: Vinayaka Chaturthi
items.procedure: Ganesha puja; offer modak/durva; seek wisdom and success.
items.significance: Worship of Lord Ganesha for wisdom, success, and auspicious beginnings.

items.name: Skanda Shashti
items.procedure: Murugan/Kartikeya worship; prayers for courage and victory.
items.significance: Dedicated to Lord Murugan/Kartikeya for courage and victory over negativity.

items.name: Samvatsari Parva (for some Hindu sects)
items.procedure: Self-reflection, forgiveness, and repentance practices as per sect/tradition.
items.significance: Day of repentance, forgiveness, and self-purification (observed in certain traditions).

items.name: Indira Ekadashi
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja and charity; prayers for ancestors’ peace.
items.significance: Vishnu worship to help ancestors attain peace and liberation.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship in Pradosh Kaal; bilva leaves and aarti.
items.significance: Evening Shiva worship for peace and fulfillment of desires.

items.name: Anant Chaturdashi
items.procedure: Worship Lord Vishnu (Anant); tie Anant sutra (if followed); prayers for protection.
items.significance: Worship of Lord Vishnu (Anant) for protection, continuity, and well-being.

items.name: Ganesh Visarjan
items.procedure: Bid farewell to Ganesha idol with prayers; visarjan in water body as per rules/tradition.
items.significance: Ritual farewell to Lord Ganesha, symbolizing impermanence and gratitude.

items.name: Pitru Paksha Begins
items.procedure: Begin shraddha/tarpan as per family tradition; charity and prayers for ancestors.
items.significance: Fortnight dedicated to ancestor worship, Shraddha, and gratitude.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship; bilva leaves and aarti in Pradosh Kaal.
items.significance: Shiva worship for spiritual strength and clarity.

items.name: Pitru Paksha Ends (Sarva Pitru Amavasya)
items.procedure: Final day shraddha/tarpan; charity; prayers for peace of all ancestors.
items.significance: Final day of ancestor rites; prayers for peace and liberation of ancestors.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship; bilva leaves and aarti in Pradosh Kaal.
items.significance: Evening worship of Lord Shiva to remove obstacles and gain peace and prosperity.

items.name: Ashwin Amavasya / Sarva Pitru Amavasya
items.procedure: Perform shraddha/tarpan; donate food/clothes; prayers for ancestors’ peace.
items.significance: Most important day of Pitru Paksha; prayers, charity, and Shraddha for all ancestors.

items.name: Chandra Darshan
items.procedure: Offer arghya to Moon; pray for peace and prosperity.
items.significance: First sighting of the Moon; worship for mental peace and prosperity.

items.name: Vinayaka Chaturthi
items.procedure: Ganesha puja; offer modak/durva; seek wisdom and success.
items.significance: Worship of Lord Ganesha for wisdom, success, and auspicious beginnings.

items.name: Skanda Shashti
items.procedure: Murugan/Kartikeya worship; prayers for courage and protection.
items.significance: Dedicated to Lord Murugan/Kartikeya for courage, victory, and protection.

items.name: Upang Lalita Vrat Begins
items.procedure: Begin preparatory vrat/puja as per tradition; focus on Devi worship and discipline.
items.significance: Preparatory vrat leading to Sharad Navratri; devotion to Goddess Durga.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva puja; bilva offering and aarti in Pradosh Kaal.
items.significance: Shiva worship for harmony, health, and spiritual strength.

items.name: Sharad Navratri – Day 1
items.procedure: Kalash sthapana (if followed), Devi puja, mantra japa, and sattvik diet.
items.significance: Beginning of Navratri; worship of Maa Durga for power, purity, and protection.

items.name: Sharad Navratri – Day 2
items.procedure: Continue Devi worship with prayers and discipline.
items.significance: Devotion to Durga for balance, courage, and inner strength.

items.name: Sharad Navratri – Day 3
items.procedure: Devi puja, japa, and charity; maintain sattvik routine.
items.significance: Worship for clarity, discipline, and devotion.

items.name: Sharad Navratri – Day 4
items.procedure: Continue Devi sadhana; focus on stability and inner strength.
items.significance: Observed for stability, wisdom, and spiritual growth.

items.name: Sharad Navratri – Day 5
items.procedure: Devi worship and prayers; keep sattvik diet and discipline.
items.significance: Sadhana for patience, discipline, and divine grace.

items.name: Sharad Navratri – Day 6
items.procedure: Devi puja; prayers for courage and focus.
items.significance: Worship for courage, focus, and removal of fear.

items.name: Sharad Navratri – Day 7
items.procedure: Devi worship; pray for protection from negativity (Kalratri devotion in many traditions).
items.significance: Devotion to Maa Kalratri for protection from negativity.

items.name: Sharad Navratri – Day 8 (Durga Ashtami)
items.procedure: Ashtami puja; kanya pujan (if followed); charity and aarti.
items.significance: Worship of Maa Mahagauri; purity, peace, and blessings.

items.name: Sharad Navratri – Day 9 (Maha Navami)
items.procedure: Navami puja; conclude Navratri sadhana; prayers for fulfillment.
items.significance: Completion of Navratri; attainment of divine blessings and fulfillment.

items.name: Vijaya Dashami (Dussehra)
items.procedure: Celebrate victory of good over evil; worship weapons/books (Ayudha puja in some regions).
items.significance: Celebrates victory of good over evil; triumph of dharma.

items.name: Papankusha Ekadashi
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja and charity; prayers for merit.
items.significance: Vishnu worship to remove sins and gain spiritual merit.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship; bilva leaves and aarti in Pradosh Kaal.
items.significance: Shiva worship for peace, prosperity, and mental clarity.

items.name: Kojagiri Purnima / Sharad Purnima
items.procedure: Lakshmi puja; keep night vigil in some traditions; offer kheer (regional).
items.significance: Worship of Goddess Lakshmi; prosperity, abundance, and divine grace.

items.name: Sankashti Chaturthi
items.procedure: Fast till moonrise; Ganesha puja and aarti after moon दर्शन.
items.significance: Ganesha fasting to overcome obstacles and hardships.

items.name: Masik Shivaratri
items.procedure: Shiva abhishekam and japa; night prayers for purification.
items.significance: Monthly Shivaratri for inner purification and devotion to Shiva.

items.name: Kalashtami
items.procedure: Bhairava worship; diya and mantra chanting for protection.
items.significance: Worship of Lord Bhairava for protection from fear and negativity.

items.name: Rama Ekadashi
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja and charity; prayers for liberation.
items.significance: Vishnu worship to cleanse sins and progress toward liberation.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship; bilva leaves and aarti in Pradosh Kaal.
items.significance: Evening worship of Lord Shiva for peace, prosperity, and removal of obstacles.

items.name: Karwa Chauth
items.procedure: Women fast till moonrise; puja with karwa; break fast after viewing moon.
items.significance: Married women fast for the long life, health, and well-being of their husbands.

items.name: Ahoi Ashtami
items.procedure: Mothers observe vrat; worship Ahoi Mata; pray for children’s well-being.
items.significance: Mothers pray for the protection, longevity, and prosperity of their children.

items.name: Rama Ekadashi
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja and charity; prayers for liberation.
items.significance: Vishnu worship to cleanse sins and progress toward spiritual liberation.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship; abhishekam and aarti in Pradosh Kaal.
items.significance: Shiva worship for harmony, health, and inner stability.

items.name: Dhanteras
items.procedure: Lakshmi and Dhanvantari puja; clean home; buy utensils/gold (optional).
items.significance: Worship of Lakshmi and Dhanvantari for wealth, health, and prosperity.

items.name: Naraka Chaturdashi (Choti Diwali)
items.procedure: Early morning bath; light diyas; prayers to remove negativity; celebrate with family.
items.significance: Symbolizes the destruction of evil and removal of negativity.

items.name: Kali Chaudas
items.procedure: Kali/Bhairava worship (regional); light lamps and pray for protection.
items.significance: Worship of Goddess Kali for protection from fear and negative energies.

items.name: Diwali / Lakshmi Puja
items.procedure: Lakshmi-Ganesha puja; light diyas; keep home clean; share sweets and gifts.
items.significance: Worship of Goddess Lakshmi for prosperity, abundance, and divine blessings.

items.name: Govardhan Puja / Annakut
items.procedure: Krishna worship; offer Annakut (variety of foods); gratitude to nature.
items.significance: Celebrates Krishna’s protection of devotees and gratitude to nature.

items.name: Bhai Dooj
items.procedure: Sister applies tilak; prayers for brother’s long life; exchange gifts.
items.significance: Celebrates the sacred bond between brothers and sisters with prayers for protection.

items.name: Chandra Darshan
items.procedure: Offer arghya to Moon; prayers for peace and prosperity.
items.significance: First sighting of the Moon after Amavasya; prayers for peace and prosperity.

items.name: Yama Dwitiya (alternate observance)
items.procedure: Regional observance; prayers to Yama for longevity and protection.
items.significance: Worship of Yama for longevity and protection (regional observance).

items.name: Vinayaka Chaturthi
items.procedure: Ganesha puja; offer durva and modak; seek wisdom and success.
items.significance: Worship of Lord Ganesha for success, wisdom, and new beginnings.

items.name: Skanda Shashti
items.procedure: Murugan/Kartikeya worship; prayers for courage and victory.
items.significance: Dedicated to Lord Murugan/Kartikeya for courage and victory over negativity.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship; bilva leaves and aarti in Pradosh Kaal.
items.significance: Shiva worship for peace, stability, and spiritual strength.

items.name: Devutthana Ekadashi (Tulsi Vivah)
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja; mark end of Chaturmas; begin auspicious ceremonies.
items.significance: Awakening of Vishnu; end of Chaturmas and start of auspicious ceremonies.

items.name: Tulsi Vivah
items.procedure: Symbolic marriage of Tulsi with Vishnu/Shaligram; puja and bhajans; charity.
items.significance: Sacred marriage of Tulsi and Vishnu; symbolizes purity and devotion.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship; abhishekam and aarti in Pradosh Kaal.
items.significance: Evening Shiva worship for prosperity and fulfillment of desires.

items.name: Kartik Purnima
items.procedure: Holy bath, charity, lighting lamps; Vishnu/Shiva puja as per tradition.
items.significance: Sacred full moon; charity, holy baths, and devotion grant spiritual merit.

items.name: Masik Shivaratri
items.procedure: Shiva abhishekam, japa, and prayers for purification.
items.significance: Monthly devotion to Lord Shiva for inner purification.

items.name: Kalashtami
items.procedure: Bhairava worship; light diya and chant mantras for protection.
items.significance: Worship of Lord Bhairava for protection from fear and negativity.

items.name: Utpanna Ekadashi
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja; prayers honoring Ekadashi Devi; charity.
items.significance: Celebrates appearance of Ekadashi Devi; Vishnu worship for liberation.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship in Pradosh Kaal; bilva leaves and aarti.
items.significance: Evening worship of Lord Shiva for peace, prosperity, and removal of obstacles.

items.name: Margashirsha Purnima
items.procedure: Holy bath, charity, and puja; prayers for spiritual merit.
items.significance: Sacred full moon; charity, devotion, and spiritual merit.

items.name: Sankashti Chaturthi
items.procedure: Fast till moonrise; Ganesha puja and aarti after moon दर्शन.
items.significance: Fast for Lord Ganesha to overcome challenges and delays.

items.name: Masik Shivaratri
items.procedure: Shiva abhishekam and mantra japa; night prayers as per ability.
items.significance: Monthly devotion to Lord Shiva for inner purification.

items.name: Kalashtami
items.procedure: Bhairava worship; diya and mantras for protection from negativity.
items.significance: Worship of Lord Bhairava for protection from fear and negativity.

items.name: Mokshada Ekadashi
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja; read Bhagavad Gita (as per tradition).
items.significance: Vishnu worship; reading the Bhagavad Gita brings liberation and peace.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship; abhishekam and aarti in Pradosh Kaal.
items.significance: Shiva worship for harmony, health, and spiritual growth.

items.name: Amavasya (Margashirsha Amavasya)
items.procedure: Pitru tarpan and charity; prayers for ancestors; sattvik routine.
items.significance: Ancestor rituals, fasting, charity, and spiritual cleansing.

items.name: Chandra Darshan
items.procedure: Offer arghya to Moon; pray for mental peace and prosperity.
items.significance: First sighting of the Moon; prayers for mental peace and prosperity.

items.name: Vinayaka Chaturthi
items.procedure: Ganesha puja; offer durva and modak; seek wisdom and success.
items.significance: Worship of Lord Ganesha for wisdom and success in new beginnings.

items.name: Skanda Shashti
items.procedure: Murugan/Kartikeya worship; prayers for courage and victory.
items.significance: Dedicated to Lord Murugan/Kartikeya for courage and victory.

items.name: Saphala Ekadashi
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja and charity; prayers for success and stability.
items.significance: Vishnu worship; grants success, stability, and fulfillment of desires.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship; bilva leaves, diya, and aarti.
items.significance: Shiva worship for peace, prosperity, and inner balance.

items.name: Gita Jayanti
items.procedure: Read/chant Bhagavad Gita; reflect on dharma; prayers and discourse (satsang).
items.significance: Celebrates the day Krishna revealed the Bhagavad Gita; wisdom and dharma.

items.name: Dattatreya Jayanti
items.procedure: Dattatreya puja; chant Dattatreya mantras; charity and prayers for guidance.
items.significance: Birth of Lord Dattatreya, embodiment of the Trimurti; spiritual guidance.

items.name: Masik Durgashtami
items.procedure: Durga puja; Devi stotra; light diya and offer flowers.
items.significance: Worship of Maa Durga for strength and protection.

items.name: Pradosh Vrat
items.procedure: Evening Shiva worship in Pradosh Kaal; abhishekam and aarti.
items.significance: Evening Shiva worship for fulfillment of desires and stability.

items.name: Utpanna Ekadashi (some regions)
items.procedure: Ekadashi vrat; Vishnu puja; honor Ekadashi Devi; charity.
items.significance: Honors the manifestation of Ekadashi Devi; Vishnu worship for liberation.

items.name: Pausha Purnima
items.procedure: Holy bath, charity, and spiritual practices; puja as per tradition.
items.significance: Full moon of Pausha month; holy baths, charity, and spiritual upliftment.
